_source.option_description: Whether to enable Vector Search Engine for the next generation of AI applications.
Configuration for Qdrant Refer to https://github.com/qdrant/qdrant/blob/master/config/config.yaml for details on supported values.
Whether to enable the qemu guest agent.
The ga package to use.

Path to the baseq3 files (pak*.pk3). If this is on the nix store (type = package) all .pk3 files should be saved in the top-level directory. If this is on another filesystem (e.g /var/lib/baseq3) the .pk3 files are searched in $baseq3/.q3a/baseq3/
Whether to enable Quake 3 dedicated server.
Extra configuration options. Note that options changed via RCON will not be persisted. To list all possible options, use “cvarlist 1” via RCON.
_source.option_example:
''
  seta rconPassword "superSecret"      // sets RCON password for remote console
  seta sv_hostname "My Quake 3 server"      // name that appears in server list
''

_source.option_description: Open the firewall.
The ioquake3 package to use.
UDP Port the server should listen on.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description: Path to the certificate used for SSL connections with clients.
The directory holding configuration files, the SQlite database and the SSL Cert.
Whether to enable the Quassel IRC client daemon.
The interfaces the Quassel daemon will be listening to. If [ 127.0.0.1 ], only clients on the local host can connect to it; if [ 0.0.0.0 ], clients can access it from any network interface.
The quasselDaemon package to use.
The port number the Quassel daemon will be listening to.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description: Require SSL for connections from clients.
The existing user the Quassel daemon should run as. If left empty, a default “quassel” user will be created.

QuickTun tunnels.

See http://wiki.ucis.nl/QuickTun for more information about available options.
IP address or hostname of the local end.
Local UDP port.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description:
Local secret key in hexadecimal form.

This option is deprecated. Please use services.quicktun.<name>.privateKeyFile instead.

Not needed when services.quicktun.<name>.protocol is set to raw.

Path to file containing local secret key in binary or hexadecimal form.

Not needed when services.quicktun.<name>.protocol is set to raw.
Which protocol to use.

Remote public key in hexadecimal form.

Not needed when services.quicktun.<name>.protocol is set to raw.
IP address or hostname of the remote end (use 0.0.0.0 for a floating/dynamic remote endpoint).
Whether to allow the remote address and port to change when properly encrypted packets are received.
_source.option_type: integer between 0 and 1 (both inclusive) or boolean convertible to it

_source.option_description: remote UDP port
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description: Allowed time window for first received packet in seconds (positive number allows packets from history)
Whether to operate in tun (IP) or tap (Ethernet) mode.
_source.option_type: integer between 0 and 1 (both inclusive) or boolean convertible to it

_source.option_description: Run specified command or script after the tunnel device has been opened.

Data directory for Quickwit. If you change this, you need to manually create the directory. You also need to create the quickwit user and group, or change services.quickwit.user and services.quickwit.group to existing ones with access to the directory.
Whether to enable Quickwit.
Extra command line options to pass to Quickwit.
The group quickwit runs as. Should be left at default unless you have very specific needs.
The Quickwit package to use.

Automatically restart the service on config change. This can be set to false to defer restarts on a server or cluster. Please consider the security implications of inadvertently running an older version, and the possibility of unexpected behavior caused by inconsistent versions across a cluster when disabling this option.
Quickwit configuration.
The port to listen on for gRPC traffic.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description: Listen address of Quickwit.
Rest server configuration for Quickwit
The port to listen on for HTTP REST traffic.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description: Configuration file version.
The user Quickwit runs as. Should be left at default unless you have very specific needs.
Default minimum difference between two consecutive block’s timestamps in seconds.
Whether to enable Quorum blockchain daemon.
Blockchain genesis settings.
The group as which to run quorum.
Path to the nodekey.
Allow only a defined list of nodes to connect.
Override the default port on which to listen for connections.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description: Configuration of privacy transaction manager.
Listening address for RPC connections.
API’s offered over the HTTP-RPC interface.
Enable RPC interface.
Override the default port on which to listen for RPC connections.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

_source.option_description: List of validator nodes.
Blockchain sync mode.
The user as which to run quorum.
Listening address for WS-RPC connections.
API’s offered over the WS-RPC interface.
Enable WS-RPC interface.
Origins from which to accept websockets requests
Override the default port on which to listen for WS-RPC connections.
_source.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)
